page.title: 09SWEET MAKING :HULL.
page.content: When Fred Needler started making a few boiled sweets out of sugar cane over an open fire in a tiny workshop,he probably never dreamed that the factory bearing his name would be making 130 tons of sweets a week,a hundred years later. All the sweets nowadays are made from sugar beet,grown in East Yorkshire,together with ingredients from as far as America and Africa. Although less than 500 people work here now,compared with 1500 in 1940,a lot more sweets are made today.This is because of the very modern machinery and use of computers. Many of the sweets are exported from the Hull docks in containers to countries all over the world-a far cry from the days when Fred sold his unwrapped sticky sweets from his horse and cart in the streets of Hull.
